Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Impeccable \Im*pec"ca*ble\, a. [L. impeccabilis; pref. im- not + peccare to err, to sin: cf. F. impeccable.] Not liable to sin; exempt from the possibility of doing wrong. -- n. One who is impeccable; esp., one of a sect of Gnostic heretics who asserted their sinlessness. [1913 Webster]
God is infallible, impeccable, and absolutely perfect. --P. Skelton. [1913 Webster]

impeccable adj 1: without fault or error; "faultless logic"; "speaks impeccable French"; "timing and technique were immaculate"; "an immaculate record" [syn: {faultless}, {immaculate}] 2: not capable of sin
